alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 6:21PM EDT until April 12 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms nearly stationary producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 7 and 12 inches of rain have fallen over the southeastern metro areas of Broward County and 3 to 5 inches over the Northeast Miami-Dade County. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area from these slow moving thunderstorms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Fort Lauderdale airport continues to report that the main roadways entering and exiting are flooded and impassable at this time. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Hallandale, Lauderhill, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Dania Beach, Sunny Isles Beach, West Park, Ravenswood Estates, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Estates Of Fort Lauderdale, Oak Point, Chambers Estates, Chula Vista, Port Everglades and Broadview Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
